molecular_rationale: Moderate LogP with aromatic rings enables S. aureus membrane penetration
Tricyclic scaffold provides S. aureus-specific binding geometry
Pyridine substitution maintains S. aureus activity with moderate polarity
Alkyl chain provides lipophilic character for S. aureus selectivity
High polarity and HBD count enables E. coli outer membrane transport
High TPSA and multiple H-bond acceptors favor E. coli selectivity
Completely non-polar structure optimized for S. aureus membrane penetration
Simple N-heterocycle with intermediate properties for C. albicans
